intro: Centaurea alba subsp. tenoreana, commonly known as the white knapweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are usually hairy and covered in fine绒毛. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
